newsitem.title: JAMAICA: Bankers Trust advises on Jamaica bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Bankers Trust advises on Jamaica bond issue.

text.p: The Jamaican government said Friday it had selected Bankers Trust as financial advisor for a planned international bond offering, but no date had been set for the issue and the details still remained to be worked out.

The government said it intended to offer about $100 million in medium-term securities, but "the specific terms and timing of the issue have not been determined and are subject to international market conditions," the government said in a statement.
A number of financial advisors bid to serve as financial advisors, according to the release, and Bankers Trust was selected after an evaluation by finance mininstry and central bank officials.

During the 1996-97 budget debate last year, Finance Minister Omar Davies said the government intended to raise $190 million in overseas markets. He reiterated the government's commitment to raise capital abroad during this year's budget debate in March.
The government intends to use the funds raised to reduce the cost of servicing domestic debt.
